worklogs.comment:
jpolchlo commented on pull request #5835: ARROW-6176: [Python] Allow type of ExtensionArray to be reinterpreted
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5835
 
 
   An extremely simple way to access elements of an `ExtensionArray`.  The [issue](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-6176) indicated that an `ExtensionArray` subclass would be better.  I couldn't see how that would work, so I took this approach.  As this is my first PR to Arrow, some guidance would be greatly appreciated.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------

jorisvandenbossche commented on issue #5835: ARROW-6176: [Python] Allow type of ExtensionArray to be reinterpreted
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5835#issuecomment-554010023
 
 
   @jpolchlo thanks for opening the PR!
   
   > The issue indicated that an ExtensionArray subclass would be better. I couldn't see how that would work
   
   On the mailing list you mentioned you tried this, but ran into problems with C++ ? Can you try to explain a bit more in detail what problems you ran into? Or if you still have the code, push it to some branch to show it?

jpolchlo commented on issue #5835: ARROW-6176: [Python] Allow type of ExtensionArray to be reinterpreted
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5835#issuecomment-554538617
 
 
   I started with the suggestion in the JIRA issue, but found a problem in `pyarrow_wrap_array`:
   
   ```python
   cdef api object pyarrow_wrap_array(const shared_ptr[CArray]& sp_array):
       if sp_array.get() == NULL:
           raise ValueError('Array was NULL')
   
       cdef CDataType* data_type = sp_array.get().type().get()
   
       if data_type == NULL:
           raise ValueError('Array data type was NULL')
   
       if data_type.id() == _Type_EXTENSION:
           klass = # How to get to the Python DataType to access __arrow_ext_class?
       else:
           klass = _array_classes[data_type.id()]
   
       cdef Array arr = klass.__new__(klass)
       arr.init(sp_array)
       return arr
   ```
   
   Is there a way around this that I'm not thinking of?  Seems like `data_type` is of the C++ variety and won't have access to the `__arrow_ext_array` field if I were to add it?
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

jorisvandenbossche commented on issue #5835: ARROW-6176: [Python] Allow type of ExtensionArray to be reinterpreted
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5835#issuecomment-554622463
 
 
   Quick suggestion: you could then use `pyarrow_wrap_data_type` to get the python data type object? 
   (but need to look more in detail to check if my suggestion makes sense)

balancap commented on pull request #6653: ARROW-6176: Basic implementation of __arrow_ext_class__, in pure Python
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6653
 
 
   This is a very basic implementation of what could be `__arrow_ext_class__`, i.e. allowing extension types in PyArrow to have a custom Extension Array class (useful for adding additional logic). It is an alternative to adding dynamic attributes to `ExtensionArray` (see ARROW-8131),
   
   Note, the present implementation does not keep the extension array class when serializing/deserializing to Parquet (and probably other modes of serialization). Adding this functionality would require quite a bit of additional work on the C++ codebase part (i.e. in cpp/src/arrow/python/extension_type.h and others). I can implement this aspect too, but that will definitely take me a bit more time!
   
   Of interest @kszucs @jorisvandenbossche 
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.

users@infra.apache.org

jorisvandenbossche commented on pull request #6653: ARROW-6176: [Python] Basic implementation of __arrow_ext_class__, in pure Python
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6653#discussion_r394517766
 
 

 ##########
 File path: python/pyarrow/tests/test_extension_type.py
 ##########
 @@ -267,14 +275,17 @@ def registered_period_type():
         pass
 
 
-def test_generic_ext_type():
-    period_type = PeriodType('D')
+@pytest.mark.parametrize("test_ext_class", [pa.ExtensionArray, PeriodArray])
+def test_generic_ext_type(test_ext_class):
+    period_type = PeriodType('D', test_ext_class)
     assert period_type.extension_name == "pandas.period"
     assert period_type.storage_type == pa.int64()
+    assert period_type.__arrow_ext_class__() == test_ext_class
 
 
-def test_generic_ext_type_ipc(registered_period_type):
-    period_type = PeriodType('D')
+@pytest.mark.parametrize("test_ext_class", [pa.ExtensionArray, PeriodArray])
+def test_generic_ext_type_ipc(registered_period_type, test_ext_class):
+    period_type = PeriodType('D', test_ext_class)
     storage = pa.array([1, 2, 3, 4], pa.int64())
     arr = pa.ExtensionArray.from_storage(period_type, storage)
 
 Review comment:
   is `arr` already a PeriodArray? We should then also test that
 
----------------------------------------------------------------

jorisvandenbossche commented on pull request #6653: ARROW-6176: [Python] Basic implementation of __arrow_ext_class__, in pure Python
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6653#discussion_r394513343
 
 

 ##########
 File path: python/pyarrow/array.pxi
 ##########
 @@ -2115,6 +2116,22 @@ cdef dict _array_classes = {
 }
 
 
+cdef object get_array_class_from_type(
+        const shared_ptr[CDataType]& sp_data_type):
+    cdef CDataType* data_type = sp_data_type.get()
+    if data_type == NULL:
+        raise ValueError('Array data type was NULL')
+
+    if data_type.id() == _Type_EXTENSION:
+        py_ext_data_type = pyarrow_wrap_data_type(sp_data_type)
+        py_ext_array_class = py_ext_data_type.__arrow_ext_class__()
+        if py_ext_array_class is NotImplementedError:
+            py_ext_array_class = ExtensionArray
 
 Review comment:
   Alternatively, that method could also return ExtensionArray by default?
 
----------------------------------------------------------------

issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

fields.summary: [Python] Allow to subclass ExtensionArray to attach to custom extension type

comments.body: This might be done by adding a {{ExtenstionType.\_\_arrow_ext_class\_\_}} that points to the subclass? In that way {{pyarrow_wrap_array}} can use that class instead of one of the predefined ones in {{\_array_classes}}.
